paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the BRCA2 gene, specifically the G25R variant, and its implications for genomic integrity and tumor susceptibility.

functional_data.summary: The G25R mutation disrupts the interaction between BRCA2 and PALB2, leading to reduced fertility and increased tumor susceptibility in hemizygous mutant mice.
assays: mouse embryonic stem cell functional assay

variants.segregation_data: The G25R variant was studied in a mouse model, but specific human segregation data is not provided.
variants.additional_notes: The G25R variant is associated with increased genomic instability and tumorigenesis in mouse models.
key_quotes: The severity of the phenotype increased with a decrease in the interaction between BRCA2 and PALB2.
Brca2G25R homozygosity as well as hemizygosity with Palb2 and Trp53 heterozygosity to generate an array of genotypically and phenotypically distinct mouse models.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on a specific variant in BRCA2.
